name: BEST WESTERN Carlos V

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Partner and I stayed for 9 nights late Nov. The hotel presents itself as a basic 3 star facility and that's exactly what it is. Room 306 was small, very clean. On the front of the hotel we did hear quite a bit of noise from the street. Bathroom also small but clean. Wifi included. Breakfast was not included in our rate but for a little under 10 euros per person was fine with hot and cold dishes. Staff was pleasant and spoke English well. The main drawing point of the hotel is the fantastic location. We walked everywhere we wanted to go. We looked at a larger room but noticed it only had more floor space, not more room to put things so we stayed in the original room we were given. If I had it to do over again I would have selected a 4 star property maybe, but overall I think the reviews are pretty accurate. No major complaints.
reviews.title: Basic hotel, Good location

reviews.text: Thsi hotel is located right between Sol and Gran Via (Callao) on a pedestrian street.
reviews.title: Super location
Really central a short stroll from Sol metro station, but quiet.
reviews.text: We have stayed there on many trips to Madrid and the service has always been very good. It is small but rooms have been refurbished and bathrooms are nice and clean. Plenty to eat at breakfast. Always request rooms located in the interior of the building due to street noise at night. (people talking, singing, etc.)
It is modest but excellent if you come here to shower and sleep.
reviews.title: Great option for a medium income traveler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice easy to use hotel really central for walking to many of the interesting bits of town, and you'll get a good nights sleep if you specify a quiet room on the booking form. We had room 508 which is at the back with a side window that is not overlooked. The room is not massive but perfectly adequate for a couple who spend more time looking at the sights of Madrid than television [CNN is on offer but all other TV programmes are rubbish anyway btw!]
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We had breakfast included in our booking for us a must, we avoid accommodation only/no breakfast deals which end up trying to find somewhere out on the streets to get coffee/breakfast [I have unfond memories of searching for hours in Amsterdam] The breakfast and service offered here is top class and we rate this hotel highly.
reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff and good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel at least 4 times in the past 10 years, because it is a great location for me to visit family in Madrid who only live one Metro stop from SOL. Yes I agree with other reviews, the rooms do now need freshening up! Bathroom small and also needs to be upgraded! Our room was small, bed very confortable and the room was clean. Staff very friendly and helpful, breakfast very good. We have also found that taxi drivers from the airport don't seem to know where it is. We find the best thing to do is ask for Puerta Del Sol, look for El Court Ingles (large department store) and walk up the street, hotel is 2nd road on left 5 minutes walk.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in early October 2012. The hotel was arranged by our agent, and although initially hard to find (because of basic taxi driver) we settled in to our nice but outdated decor room. The check-in staff were tops and through our leave the check-in and breakfast staff were very welcoming and helpful. The hotel has a good breakfast and is in close walk to Puetre del Sol. For here you can get the hop on bus for a good tour around the sights of the city. The room was spacious and the bathroom quite clean and functional. This is a good hotel to stay on a medium budget when in Madrid. We felt incredibly safe in this part of Madrid due to the high level of Police presence (recent Government initiative) and were happy to wander the area in late evening in well let areas. No hesitancy in recommending the Carlos V.
reviews.title: Good hotel in great location

reviews.text: Hotel was clean and help pleasant bathrooms very small but can be dealt with. Rooms needed major upgrading. Our room had a musty smell. Kept spraying it. Bedspreads were old. Could not move around in shower. Had a parlor on 1st floor that was a pleasant meeting place but that was best could say about. Breakfast was adequate.
reviews.title: Needs upgrading

reviews.text: A brief review: check in took 15 minutes, with just three couples to process. Bedroom was fine, and available 'early'. Bathroom clean, but trkly 'compressed'. Breakfast totally overpriced compared with various (very close cafes/bars)...eg 13,50 Euros for eggs and bacon. Central location great, but with it came much street noise throughout the night; worse noise though from fellow residents (kids to teenagers) who ran amok up and down stairs, slamming bedroom doors, with the staff showing little interest in 'calming' them. Bar takings are obviously not importabnt to the Hotel, as it was always difficult to get served....we finally gave up on it totally when reception said it was open but the barman insisted it was closed, and this at 10.55pm in a city centre establishment.
reviews.title: If this is a BEST Western, I'll not bother with the rest!
